items.name: National Suicide Prevention Lifeline
items.description: 988 to speak with a trained crisis counselor.

items.name: Crisis Text Line
items.description: Text 741-741 to connect with a trained crisis counselor to receive crisis support via text message.

items.name: Champaign-Urbana Crisis Line
items.description: This is similar to the national crisis line but specifically for those in the local area. This one is especially useful in that a crisis counselor can help you access local resources or help. Phone: (217) 359-4141

items.name: 911 Emergency
items.description: You can also call 911 if the crisis is a life-threatening emergency. Make sure to notify the operator that it is a psychiatric emergency and ask for an officer trained in crisis intervention or trained to assist people experiencing a psychiatric emergency.

items.name: National Domestic Violence Hotline
items.description: Call 800-799-SAFE (7233) to speak with trained experts who provide confidential support to anyone experiencing domestic violence or seeking resources and information.

items.name: Disaster Distress Helpline
items.description: Call 1-800-985-5990 or text “TalkWithUs” to 66746. The disaster distress helpline provides immediate crisis counseling for people who are experiencing emotional distress related to any natural or human-caused disaster. The helpline is free, multilingual, confidential, and available 24 hours a day, seven days a week.

items.name: Rosecrance Substance/Mental Health Helpline
items.description: Call 1-866-330-8729. This group does mental health triage at hospitals and offers partial hospitalization, mental health recovery services, and recovery living. They also have substance abuse centers (with one located in Champaign). Website: https://rosecrance.org

items.name: Social Media Support
items.description: If you are worried about someone on social media, you can contact the safety team on various social media sites (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat, YouTube, and Periscope) to ensure that they are connected with the help they need Support on Social Media.

items.name: Illinois WarmLine
items.description: Website: http://illinoismentalhealthcollaborative.com, Phone: (866) 359-7953

items.name: TalkCampus
items.description: Sign up at talkcampus.com/sign-up using an Illinois email and students can start connecting right away on the web or mobile app. If students have questions or need help getting started, call the Counseling Center at 217-333-3704 during business hours. TalkCampus connects Illinois students with others who understand what they're going through. It is safely monitored, anonymous, and available 24/7 in 26 languages, therefore, support is available whenever they need it. On TalkCampus, students can share what’s on their mind, chat one-on-one with a trained TalkCampus Buddy, join group conversations, journal, and explore self-guided tools to support their wellbeing. There’s no judgment, just real conversations with other students who have lived experience with common college stressors.

items.name: Dean of Students Office
items.description: A catch-all for general issues. Reach out to them for helping you advocate for yourself with staff, faculty, students, and other organizations on campus. Website: https://odos.illinois.edu/

items.name: Counseling Center
items.description: The UIUC Counseling Center is committed to providing a range of resources intended to help students develop improved coping skills to address emotional, interpersonal, and academic concerns. Website: https://www.counselingcenter.illinois.edu/

items.name: Office of Access and Equity
items.description: For reporting descrimination and barrier to access on campus. Website https://oae.illinois.edu/our-services/events/

items.name: Telehelp
items.description: Online counseling for students with United Healthcare. Website: http://telehelp4students.com

items.name: McKinley Health Center Mental Health
items.description: Website: https://mckinley.illinois.edu/medical-services/mental-health

items.name: Psychological Services Center
items.description: Website: http://psc.illinois.edu/, Phone: (217) 333-0041

items.name: College of Engineering Embedded Counselor: Juvenal George, Psy.D
items.description: Contact: juvegeor@illinois.edu

items.name: College of LAS Embedded Counselor: Andrew Novinska, LCPC
items.description: Contact: anovinsk@illinois.edu

items.name: Full List of embedded counselors
items.description: Website: https://counselingcenter.illinois.edu/about-us/embedded-counselors

items.name: Computer Science Undergraduate Advising
items.description: Website: https://cs.illinois.edu/academics/undergraduate/undergraduate-advising, Phone: (217) 333-4428

items.name: Grainger CARE (Center for Academic Resources In Engineering)
items.description: Website: https://care.grainger.illinois.edu/, Phone: (217) 244-2678, Email: engr-care@illinois.edu

items.name: UIUC Disability Resources and Educational Services
items.description: Website: https://dres.illinois.edu/

items.name: Women’s Resource Center
items.description: A completely no-strings-attached*, anonymous resource center for women with a wide variety of resources. Website: https://wrc.illinois.edu/, *The WRC has 4 confidential advisors not mandated to report to the Title IX office. Pursuing accountability/safety options requires a report to the Title IX Coordinator in a survivor-led, well-informed, guided manner. More info at FAQs about Employee Reporting Obligations, At Illinois We Care and at Policy Definitions & Key Terms, At Illinois We Care

items.name: National Sexual Assault Hotline
items.description: Call 800-656-HOPE (4673) to connect with a trained staff member from a sexual assault service provider in your area that offers access to a range of free services. Crisis chat support is also available at Online Hotline.
